description:
Finally, somewhere that's dedicated to tea! I loved that they have a location on Valencia and that you can pop by for a nice cup of tea. The only sad thing is the limited seating available inside, but once you have a seat along the wall, it's great. I sat there for a while reading my book and it was just lovely.

They have an insane selection of tea at all price points, and all different types. I can't remember exactly what I ordered right now, but because it was iced, it took a little longer than I expected. They steep the tea for you and then ice it accordingly so that it never really oversteeps - although I sometimes think steeping times are a bit of a personal preference if you've had enough experience with teas. As a result, I felt my green tea was slightly on the oversteeped side of things, and I would like to return to try something different. I find black teas a little more forgiving, especially when iced.

The tables are quite tiny so it's unclear to me how you'd eat anything you order here but people seem to manage so it must be just me. If I'm ever in the Mission again, I'd go back to try more teas!
author: SY C.

description:
Order: Matcha Latte with boba
Cost: $5.50
Rating: 3/5
Review: I've heard so many good things about this place but I've never had the chance to try their tea. I was craving boba and saw they offered matcha latte with boba and got excited since I love matcha. I guess I had high hopes for this spot but the boba was on the harder side and I like my boba chewy and soft. It also wasn't sweet enough for me and I'm the type of person who asks for 25 or 30% sweet.  The matcha latte itself was ok. It wasn't memorable and had more of a milky taste than matcha. I will definitely be getting my boba fix elsewhere but I would go back to give their regular tea drinks a try!
author: Valerie T.

description:
Quick Friendly Service
The Masala Chai Hot Tea is Great.
Limited seating inside and outside.
 Mostly take outs.
author: Wesley O.

description: I had the green ecstasy tea and it was great. Great tea selection. When I was there, there was live music outside (prob not a part of the tea house) but really created a great vibe to hang out. I would suggest more seating area because it was super limited, especially since everyone was holding some kinda hot drinks.
author: Kelly L.

description:
Tea: 2/5
Service: 4/5
Ambiance: 3/5
Overall: might have been what I got but the tea wasn't impressive.

The extended review...

Iced Peach Tea: can't remember the name of it exactly but there wasn't much taste to it for me.  And the ice didn't help as it only diluted the flavor even more.

Service: friendly service

Ambiance: a very cute place where you can sit for a little chit chat.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
First-time visit on a weekday afternoon, strolling around the mission. 

- Quality, modern, and rustic interior design. Love the store layout, white rustic walls, pastel-colored ceramics on shelf, and the unique vibes brought out by the aesthetics & healthy treats.

- Cozy, design-y, down-to-earth vibes.  Tea and coffee boiling in fancy copper pots. The smoke coming out just makes you want to try them! 

- Menu full of tasty-looking healthy meals. Wanted to try everything literally. Esp. the egg & greens mixed in a mason jar 

- Tiny, portable, short-height, rectangular, wood tables that are non-conventional, and are so adorable & functional that makes the dining experience personal! (Looked at stools at first, then realized they are tables!!)

- Ordered gluten free, delicious, bite-sized pastries (Matcha flavor in pic)! They come in a variety of flavors, matcha, sesame, and dark chocolate are the ones I enjoy. 

- Very happy find! Will come back to try savory foods & tea!
author: Jess W.

description:
Every time I go to the mission district I make sure to go to Samovar Tea! The chai tea and truffle avocado toast are to die for! Samovar is charmingly decorated, featuring a small sales section of modern tea ware and bags of tea. Standing out the most are the large brass pots in which the staff brew the chai tea, filling the place with a rich aroma. Once you order the chai tea, they scoop out the tea with large spoons! The place seems like a modern apothecary in that they put (what I think is) tea leaves in test tube bottles on display. A drawback in the layout is that there is very limited seating and low tables on which to put your food. They should really invest in tables to encourage people to order food... I had to sit outside in a public sitting space.

The chai tea is rich and flavorful, unlike many of the other such teas I have drunken before. I love the creaminess and the force of dairy in the tea, which might not be everybody's preference though... The truffle avocado toast is an excellent deal because it also comes with two poached eggs and a very generous amount of (I think boiled) mixed greens on the bottom. It is a delicious dose of several vitamin and minerals!! I love avocado, toasted white bread, truffle oil, and mixed greens, which makes Samovar's dish absolutely perfect!!!
author: Louis Suo L.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, and I loved the decor, but I think I made the mistake of not ordering Chai, which I am told is the specialty here. When you come here, get Chai, or a latte. I have given this four stars because the baristas were incredible.

My first mistake was in not knowing what to get. My barista was a masterful salesperson, which I respect, and he suggested the Shibumi Matcha bowl. This was a mistake on my part. 

I also thought a matcha scone would taste good, but it did not. Do not get it. The barista was incredibly kind and let me taste the scone before purchasing it, which was lucky, and I am really thankful. 

The Shibumi Matcha bowl cost $7, and was an unsweetened matcha tea with notes of rice, sweet potato, and green hay. It tasted like warm grass, and I wished I had ordered a chai tea latte or even a matcha tea latte that would have cost $4.50 or $5. 

(There is a ceremonial importance to the matcha bowl, hence the hefty price.)

The matcha scone was very strange. It was too dense and the flavors didn't play well together. Take my advice and get a chai latte.
author: Jenée S.

description:
Just as I remembered.

My visit to Samovar did not disappoint and helped me remember why I loved it so much.  

This time around we came close to noon and there was a line out the door. Not surprising, as they offer a delicious homemade chai with the option of whole or Califia almond color, iced and hot drinks as well as boba tea. 

They even have a decent amount of food options. I ordered the Chai w/ Miso soup and Tahini toast and it was just as good as I remembered.  They even have mochi cakes in a pretty impressive assortment of flavors. I tried the 2 for 3 deal and got rose-cardamom, vanilla and black sesame. This was my first time having mochi cakes and I'm not too sure how I feel about them just yet. The texture was chewy and dense and barely sweet. I definitely ate them though.

The young man helping us was patient and very helpful and our order came out quickly.
author: Sydney S.

description:
While their prices are steep ($4 for a cup of Chai) this small local chain puts their heart into every cup they sell. I'm not a tea person per se but their hot drinks here are amazing. The freshly brewed chai and the nicely prepared matcha tea are my absolute favorite. There are also food options but I found them a little bit too pricey.

Go here for the chai!
author: Sebastian F.

description:
Huge s/o to my lovely friend for taking me here. She was so excited to present their Masala Chai to me. The sound of her voice when describing it was an immediate grab for me. I can definitely tell she loves this place. Their class Chai with almond milk is delicious and is described similar to Yemeni tea which I'm curious about. 

As always, this place is a charm on Valencia and is a well known establishment for it's imported teas. Their service is quick and they're full of knowledge when asked about their product. This place hasn't changed one bit; tea is still carefully made and stirred in this rustic pot and poured into cups using a ladle. 

Grab a cup of hot creamy chai and sit out front! I guarantee you'll love it!
author: Allister D.

description:
Samovar went a different direction with this compact location and are quick to point out that this is not a tea lounge but a tea bar. Fans of the more atmospheric teahouses at Yerba Buena Gardens and the shuttered one in the Castro may be bummed that they can't order the three-tiered English service platter of quiche and finger sandwiches. But you can still get a scone here and a variety of toasts, and those may be the only food items they sell here. If you ask me (and even if you didn't), this was the economically sound thing for Samovar to do.

And frankly I'm not a pinkies-up-type of teetotaler who needs to wear my derby and ascot to drink a cup of tea. Why I'm as common as Eliza Doolittle I am. I washed me hands and feet before I come I did, and that's why the concept of a tea bar appeals to me I guess. It frankly looks and feels a lot more like a Blue Bottle than a Lovejoy's, and you order from a rather extensive menu that is vertically placed as you walk through the door. I tried the rather premium-priced $7 Saffron Rapture with "notes of saffron, quince, apple, and citrus" (photo: http://bit.ly/2zNXAKE).

It was quite tasty though I'm used to getting a Venti Peach Tranquility for $2.65 at Starbucks because I'm common I is. Come on, Dover! Move your bloomin' arse! Anyhow I waited patiently for my tea to be brewed as others kept to themselves on their smartphones. I took advantage of the adjacent parklet to sip it because it was a bit too hot for me to drink and walk at the same time. This stretch of Valencia isn't quite as plebeian as other blocks in the Mission, so having a pause here can be quite pleasing on a balmy evening. After all, the rain in Spain falls mainly in the plain.

TEA - 4 stars...pricey but genuinely satisfying tea if you care for subtlety in your flavors
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...airy and bright space even if there is barely room to sit and wait for your cup to be brewed
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...fairly transactional but definitely personalized
TOTAL - 4 stars...no need to have afternoon tea with Henry Higgins...you can take it to go and oh, wouldn't it be loverly?
author: Ed U.

description:
I had high expectations before visiting Samovar on Valencia and I am quite disappointed. 

The quality of the tea was superb as advertised: I tried their Masala Chai and it was delicious. It was flavorful with so many spices. It is easy to tell this was special. 

The venue is very cool. White stone bench inside and a few stools allow a small number of people to enjoy their drinks inside. There is also some seating outside on the street. The high ceiling, the less is more type of interior design, and the ceramic looking mugs lined up on the wall behind the bar are trendy. 

My disappointment was not about the tea but the operation. I asked for a mug to enjoy my chai inside and was told that mugs were being washed and only paper cups were available. It doesn't look like that there is a lot of seating inside and outside to begin with and everyone inside were drinking from paper cups. This is something that never happens next door at Four Barrel. I got my cup and started looking for seating. That's when I realized the place feels so spacious (although the space is small) because the layout allows a lot of space for the ordering line and the bar but not for customers to sit down. I would understand if the establishment chooses to be a take-out kind of place. That could work with coffee but with tea, I expect to be able to enjoy it rather than being forced out. I am curious to try their two other locations in the city.
author: Doruk B.

description:
I would give this 0 stars if I could.

Positives - the space is pretty and bright. The tea is good.

Negatives - the space is tough to sit or hang out on, even for the time you're waiting, you get in the way of the line. The tea is also way too expensive, especially for the chai which is premade and then poured into a pretty brass pot for the "looks" of authenticity.

More negatives - I ordered 2 vegan chais from here recently, and got lids that did not seal around the edge. It wasn't one of those "maybe it's sealed but actually then it pops off because it wasn't really sealed" situations. It was a "tightly closed on the cup, but not quite tight enough because liquid was spilling over the edges anyway".

Which makes it difficult to ride an uber, walk around, or do anything other than sit in the shop -- except there aren't really any seats there, or it's not designed as an inviting place to sit and lounge.

I felt terrible for my lyft driver and had no option but to let the tea just continue spilling into my lap and my purse, instead of his car. Ouch (and poor leather wallet got ruined!)

Thanks for the fancy tea (which is really tasty), maybe with the $5.5 you charge per cup (at LEAST), you could find lids that actually close and seal? And perhaps some cupholders? But really, with the lids.
author: Victoria C.

description: The perfect place to go to on a chilly Fall night. The decor is inviting and the staff is friendly. They offered samples of masala chai. It is spicy but comforting. I got the Golden Phoenix tea. Almost $9!!! But brewed perfectly and didn't need any sweetener.
author: Kimberly L.

description: Came here after lunch and wanted a vanilla chai. Walked in and the lace is pretty trendy, felt the chill cool vibe. They didn't have a vanilla chai but the rep helped me find something similar and even let me sample it before ordering the $4.50 drink, which was a sell right there. This place has a cool stadium seating and clean fun art bathroom for customer use!
author: Julianne O.

description:
Good tea, had the Tumeric masala tea, wish they had a location down in South Bay!!
I didn't get to try their food yet but saw some of it and looks tasty, the place looked very nice and service was good.
author: Bobby W.

description:
I've been here a few times, and the drinks are always delicious! I've gotten the chai twice and the Tart Peach tea once. The prices aren't actually that high, since chai is often pricey, and this tea is really high quality. They actually steep the tea for you to make sure you don't leave the tea leaves in for too long, which would make the tea too bitter. 

The lack of seating inside is a bit unfortunate, but there is a great parklet right outside that offers great seating on a nice day. 

The service was fine. The cashier was friendly, though she didn't know how to use the code that the tea shop had emailed me for a discount. 

One thing to note is that the chai drink is not a latte, which I was not aware of. It has the consistency of tea, which is not a bad thing, just something to be aware of when ordering your drink. 

There can definitely be a line, but it comes and goes. I didn't have to wait in a line but one formed as soon as I left.
author: Amara C.

description: Stumbled into this place because of the enticing aroma of spices that filled the air around this little shop. Chai is one of my favorite drinks, so I was excited that a place like this exists! The interior is beautiful, minimalist and modern. They let you sample the different chai tea options before ordering. I didn't know almond milk chai tea could be so flavorful! They also have some yummy gluten-free muffins, I got the cardamom one and it was the perfect complement to my tea. Definitely would stop by here again if I was in the area.
author: Josephine M.

description:
Tea: First time visiting a tea house instead of my normal coffee shops. I probably ordered the wrong tea, but the moon bud tea didn't taste any different from the tea I get from the grocery store. I was sorta disappointed in my drink and was not too happy that I spent $4 for a cup of tea. I'd also like to warn people to just wait a good 10 minutes before drinking your tea because it's searing hot.

Ambiance: This is a pretty tea house and definitely very unique. The interior is really calm and minimalist. However, this place does lack seating. There is a long bench inside the store that can maybe seat 10 people max. They do have some outdoor seating as well. All I have to say is if you plan on eating here, good luck finding space or a wooden stool to eat off of.

Staff: I came here right before the morning rush on a Sunday and the staff members could've been more attentive. There was a growing line in front and only 2/3 employees were working. One employee was instead talking to her friend and not really helpful in mitigating the traffic.
author: Kenneth L.

description: Such a busy and small place. There's isn't much room to stand in wait especially if the sitting area is full. No traditional sitting instead large step stones. Not the best environment to get comfortable, but maybe that's the point. Had tea and matcha while my sister had the chai. Wasn't sure it was truly worth the wait. The place is very well styled.
author: Ellie G.

description:
Cute, aesthetically pleasing cafe for a huge variety of green, black, white, oolong, pu-erh, herbal teas, lattes and artisanal toasts. Beautiful and quality cafe for tea lovers! Seems like their speciality is chai. They have copper pots brewing all day and it smells lovely. This is my favorite cafe in SF.

The interior is pretty tasteful, and there's a bunch of white ceramic cups lining the wall with some nice lighting. Seating is limited to a side bench against a wall and there's small wooden coffee tables to set your drinks on. This spot seems more like a grab and go type cafe.

Menu is pretty extensive. They have treats like egg or warm veggies (they come in mason jars!) and toasts. If you're feeling millennial, there's Truffle Avocado Toast for $13. They have gluten free sourdough too. The tea is sourced organically and imported and you can really taste the quality. Drinks will run you around $4-5, and the menu is a bit pricy but it's worth. At the counter they have a huge selection of cute (but expensive) mochi cakes.

This place is related to the Samovar Tea Lounge in Soma but I feel like it hardly compares. The food is really mediocre there in my opinion. 

EAT

Egg Jar - Sous vide egg, smoked salmon, organic brown rice, sauerkraut, furikake, sesame oil, soy sauce. Cute food concept, pretty good to munch on. I mostly got it because of the aesthetic. There's a little too much soy sauce.

Truffle Avocado Toast - Avocado, sous vide eggs, white truffle oil, salt, butter, pepper. A bit on the expense side for $12 but this is a pretty filling dish. Comes with cooked spinach in a pretty interesting dressing. It's a bit on the salty side so I recommend balancing it out with a sweet toast.

Miso Tahini Toast - Housemade miso tahini spread, furikake. The toasts are thick and tasty! I personally liked the saltiness of the tahini spread it was pretty unique. Came with nice toasted rice puffs on it.

Make sure to look out for their toast & tea specials. The Strawberry & Rye Toast is popular here.

Cashew Cardamom Toast - Pan de mie toast, butter, cashew-cardamom almond butter, Maldon salt. Amazing almond butter that tastes similar to chai flavor because of the cardamom. The portion for the butter is generous and it was finger lickin' good! 

Cinnamon Maca Toast - Similar to the Cashew Cardamom but with a slight difference in taste.

Matcha Mochi Cake - Pretty good, nothing too special. They're small and bite sized so try some different flavors if you can.

CHAI & LATTE

Traditional Masala Chai Latte - Made really well! I love the flavor and can taste the spices pretty well. 

HERBAL

Cacao Mint - Cacao, mint, lavender. Super savory drink! I love how rich the flavor was.

We also got to sample a pumpkin almond latte they had at the counter which was pretty good but a bit overpowering.

On a day I'm feeling like treating myself to some high end tea, Samovar is my top choice!
author: Chelsea W.

description: Cool staff, nice small space, and awesome Chai Tea, which you can order iced or hot with a variety of milks, including almond. You can see the huge pots of chai that they brew, too. It smells delicious in here. :)
author: Cece Y.

description:
Extremely disappointed with this place. Food had no flavor and the service was non existent. Sometimes you go to restaurants and the good service makes up for the bad food you just had but not this place. Overpriced tastless food + horrible customer service = disappointing experience. The outdoor seating area scenery is enjoyable though, giving it a 1 star just for that. 

Don't get the breakfast wrap or veggie quiche unless you like food with no flavor - no salt, pepper, spices, nothing. I sat there with my food waiting for the waiter to come by so I can ask him for some lemons or pepper to give it some flavor but he never came back after he brought the food. We were observing the other waiter at the other tables and they were so friendly and checking on their tables frequently. Our waiter only came back to give us the check. After we paid he immediately picked up the check while we were still sitting there and began to clean up the table, maybe to signal us it's time to leave! Because of this awkward and uncomfortable situation, we did not tip him. He was angry about this and said something under his breath as we were leaving. Just ridiculous.
author: Farah A.

description:
An exquisite and exotic tea place. They specialize in Indian themed teas. Highly recommend checking this place out. 

The venue is pretty spacious but there isn't much seating. Service is quick and friendly. 

I ordered the ginger turmeric latte and I've gotten the chai latte. Both are really really exotic. The chai was especially striking.
author: Sean W.

description:
Omg, the smell of chai that always wafts from this place makes me want to package Samovar Tea into its own perfume bottle.

Menu prices are intimidating, but in my opinion, you really do get your money's worth. It's very clear that you get high-quality tea from Samovar Tea, and I appreciate that they use their own clock timers to accurately brew each cup. I can't say much for their chai (since I've never ordered chai from here), but I really, REALLY enjoyed their Velvet Cacao Pu-Erh. All the flavor notes that were highlighted on the menu were definitely there, and it was such a perfect way to warm up. Will definitely make my way back here soon. Just not too soon, otherwise my wallet will be very unhappy with me.
author: Connie X.

description:
Saffron rapture. Bright nose, looks to have chunks of fruit in the tea. 5 minutes brew time. Recommended when I asked for something citrusy and refreshing prior to dinner. First recommendation had been jasmine but I was heading to sushi and knew that would be available there.

Inside the shop is a beautiful large flat wood flooring. The center post is stone and there are stone benches along the wall to sit on. Definitely a zen garden type of vibe but not necessarily warm and inviting. Awesome lighting.

Overall definitely a cool spot to check out, especially if you like tiny mochi cakes and cups of tea. Wouldn't recommend for a long cozy afternoon but totally worth a visit!
author: Angela D.

description:
I had book marked a few places near our hotel for coffee before we came out for a concert.  I've never had an authentic chai, so this peaked my interest. This morning I felt like tea over coffee, so this was the winner.  
It's a small location, but there is plenty of room inside to sit and chat, with a few seats outside as well. It's very modern and clean looking inside.  There were a few copper pots of masala chai to the left of the register, and fresh mochi to the right.  I was having a hard time deciding between a matcha latte and masala chai, but the display and aroma lead me to purchase 1 chai and 1 matcha mochi for my son. 
The chai was delicious, and not as sweet (that's a good thing) as I was anticipating.  It had a perfect amount of spice for me, which is probably a little spicier than what others might like.  The mochi smells delicious, but at 1.75 per piece, I will have to refrain and let my son be the taste tester.
Glad I came, and next time I'm in town I'll try the matcha.
author: Amanda F.

description:
Oh boy. It's up it's down it's up it's down. I just ate here today and wish I'd donated the $15 to one of the many homeless street people nearby who could have benefited. Because What a waste. The 'egg jar' that used to be quite delicious was almost inedible. Egg was almost raw, most the jar was over cooked brown rice with zero seasoning, the 'warm greens' I was charged $3 to add in were a bunch of raw kale smashed in the jar, not even steamed, and then MAYBE a teaspoon of salmon. BAD.  This used to be served in a plentiful bowl with lots of seasoning between each layer. Now it's a dollar and half more, and much smaller (tho that's good since it's inedible:) 


Did I mention The poor guy behind the counter seemed overrun so perhaps most dishes came out horribly .  I even gave them all a big tip despite the surliness cuz everyone there just seems so damn miserable.  But I can't eat there again. 

So alas I say goodbye to fighting for a spot on those hard cement stairs surrounded by unpleasant white hipsters ...au revoir.  Too many other amazing spots where a great dish can be had for that price.
author: T S.

description:
Oh, Samovar! [In my best ANTM Tyra Banks voice] I was rooting for you! We were all rooting for you!

I have a been a fan of the Samovar cafe/restaurant group since my days living in San Francisco. While I thought an average meal or tea experience was on the pricier side of things, I thought the quality of their loose leaf teas was top notch (and the food items were tasty and uniquely created). In recent years, some of their older locations closed, and I decided to check out this Valencia Street location while I was in the Mission. 

My friend and I were both eager to try their Masala chai, and boy, did the employee working at the front keep us waiting. There was neither an acknowledgment when we got into the line or even some brief statement explaining why he spent several long minutes chatting with a person who seems like a close friend (their extended goodbye made it clear that they were quite tight). If I hadn't agreed to treat my friend to some tea, I would have bounced as soon as I noticed that good customer service was not on the menu that day. 

We finally ordered our chai, which was scalding-I guess what they lack in expediency they make up for in heat. The chai was OK, but the texture was impacted by the occasional milk skin pieces that likely formed from overheating. The rest of the service staff seemed quite lackadaisical, and the presumed manager appeared to be more interested in socializing than running his cafe. 

Maybe this Samovar branch is for people with an expanded definition of service and tea quality, but I'm pretty sure I won't be back in the future.
author: Keith H.

description:
After having visited the Samovar Tea in Yerba Buena that is really nice, I thought I'd also give this place a try too. Unfortunately, this place is completely different and did not live up to expectations. Located near 16th St Mission bart, this place isn't too difficult to get to by public transit. The interior decor is very concrete and unique and I actually really liked it despite seating being very limited. The aroma of the chai here is very strong.

Since I am not a huge fan of chai, I opted to get the matcha latte. Even though I ordered it "for here," they put it in a to-go cup so keep that in mind.. I was more disappointed though in the taste of the matcha latte. After traveling around California and New York, I've had some really good matcha lattes and this one was just not up to par. The matcha just tasted powdery and watery and was not made well. This place might be a better place to get chai for the chai lovers out there. Stay away if you're a matcha lover though.
author: Catherine S.

description: The pleasant scent of chai floating out of this tea bar is enough to reel in an unsuspecting passerby. Samovar's Masala Chai definitely hit the spot on a cold evening in the Mission. A wonderfully brewed cup of such creamy and delicious chai with just enough sweetness and spice! This has to be probably the best chai I have ever tried. It was quite busy when I visited, so I took my chai to-go, but I hope to come back soon to maybe try other drinks and find a seat!
author: Katrine U.

description: I live two blocks away from this tea place.  i pass this tea spot a couple times when I'm walking home. The looks of the appealing of this cafe and the smell definitely catch your attention. I told myself one day, when i have the time i will try it. Well Today were the day, i just got my tea 10 mins ago. I'm Disappointed as heck. I ordered a Hong Kong black tea and it were Flat and watery. Secondly, the operation of this place suck. THIS WILL BE MY FIRST N LAST TIME COMING HERE. I rather spent my money elsewhere for a better chai tea latte. Waste of my money.  Don't be fool by their appealing and smell. There drinks don't even own up to it.
author: Tyda L.

description:
I LOVE Samovar Tea Lounge in the Yerba Buena gardens. It is absolutely one my favorite places when visiting San Francisco. I was really excited when my daughter booked a facial for my birthday at This Magic Life and I was scheduled to be in the area one hour before my appointment. 

I walked in to see that this was just a to-go place and there was public outdoor seating and stadium style seating to the side. Everything was still beautiful! The signature teas were steeping in beautiful copper pots which are best for conducting heat. The cashier offered me a sample of their signature Masala Chai but it wasn't what I thought it was. I decided to order a Matcha Latte since they use premium Matcha powder and one of the most popular items, "Eggs in a Jar." I thought this was San Francisco's version of Eggslut. The eggs in a jar were two perfectly sous vide eggs on top of organic brown rice, sauerkraut and smoked wild salmon sprinkled with furikake and soy sauce and sesame oil. I could have done without the soy sauce and the salmon was only like a tablespoon worth. It was expensive at over $10 even though it came with a Ball mason jar! The green tea latte was $5 and very bland and came lukewarm. It was a surprisingly unsweetened but went well with the eggs in a jar. 

I don't mind spending $$ on amazing food but I spent close to $20 for a mediocre breakfast. I earned a star on FiveStars though...
author: Christina W.

description: Tea was good/ok and boba not very good/low quality but the most annoying thing was they wouldn't put boba in any tea except the four specified options. Why not?! :(
author: J D.

description:
Glutenfree Mochi cakes 
Nice staff
Almond milk

And... c'mon look at that tea assortment!

Really, how can you not try "Maiden's ecstasy Pu-erh?"
author: Raymond B.

description: Love this place. The best chai tea anywhere in the Bay Area, including the famed Vic's chaat Corner in Berkeley. I also love the great tea selection here and their other locations and usually nice spaces to enjoy your drink and some small plates of food have been pretty good the few times I've ordered a small meal there.
author: Andrea Y.

description:
Tea Bar. Not Lounge. Tea BAR. Not ROOM. I get the need for quick Touch n Go's because the real estate is tight in the City, but 3/4 of wall furniture is not enough for me to enjoy a cup o'tea. They have this same setup at Wrecking Ball, probably one of the reasons why I rated that experience less than a 4 compared to everyone else.

I was kind of in a rush for a tattoo appt down the block so I had about 20-30 minutes to stuff a savory & dessert toast along with hot houjicha. The toast took some time... they were in the midst of training the cashier too so he seemed a little blank taking orders in. I'd pass on the Honey-happy Butter Toast, but the Truffle Egg & Avocado held me over pretty well for about 6+ hours. Very generous with their spinach and Real avocado halves if you're in that high tax bracket nowadays.

I wanted to take a sweetened iced tea in their Rose Palm for my sess but sadly I ran out of time. I'd give this place another shot just because it's a nice space to watch a bunch of yogis next door try to hatch a pose in front of the wall mural. It's a busy walkway dude(ttes)... Pretty. Funny. Cute. Pretty funny & cute.

Till next time.
author: Jason A.

description:
This place has really good ambiance and decor but space is very limited. There's no private tables but against the wall is a stone bench for communal seating that's cool. 

They have a massive selection of teas but no coffee just in case you're wondering. I got their traditional masala chai. When you go up to the register, you see these two large copper pots on the stove. Each is filled with one of the chais so each cup isn't brewed on the spot but rather poured from the pot in a cool af ladle. 

As for the masala chai itself, it's soooooo hot. Like I've been sitting here for awhile and it's still piping hot. If you're used to ordering chai teas elsewhere you know it rarely comes this hot. I had to grab a smaller cup to pour some out and cool it to taste it. 

Overall the flavor is nice and spicy. Kinda more watery but the intensity of the flavors is nice. I wish it was more of a latte and less volcanically hot.
author: Michael L.

description:
I've been a longtime patron of the other Samovar locations, but this one was below expectations:

1) Waited over 10 mins in a line of 3 people, each with normal (small) orders, while one of the three staff members on duty visibly stood staring at a distant wall.

2) Waited over 10 mins, after asking the unoccupied staff member about my drink.

3) About 3 mins after that, finally saw them making the Turmeric Coconut Latte, starting with a 1/4 teaspoon of salt (that's enough salt to season a plate of dinner). 

4) Latte tasted painful, had no coconut, no sweetener at all, and had to get thrown out. I think they forgot to add the coconut milk syrup? And it could work with a pinch of salt, but not a spoonful like what they put in.

Summary: waited over 20 mins for an un-drinkable $6 drink that had to get wasted :(

I really want to like this Samovar because of the beautiful little snacks and the general concept, but there's no seating (you have to sit at the Parklet outside, which itself only has a few spots), it's not cozy, the staff are not on point, and the drink was un-drinkable. 
Disappointing for a Samovar.
author: Susan S.

description:
The earthy aroma of fresh chai will feel your lungs and make you crave some fresh brewed tea! Seriously.

Tea: Elaborate list of teas to chose from, from warm to iced teas. I opted for the Iced Cacao . Hint of toasted cacao, fresh peppermint and aromatic lavender. The breakdown of ingredients in this herbal tea just screams therapeutic! That's exactly what it was, therapy for my tastebuds and soul. I felt awakened and satisfied by my iced tea. If you're not up for an iced drink, you can make order the tea hot. If you're not up for a tea, they have a variety of healthy and fresh eats and sweets! 

Ambiance: Hip, clean, busy, vibrant and relaxing tea bar. 

Staff: Friendly, youthful and fun staff members.

Price: Pretty pricey, but worth the price.. just focus on the quality!

Overall: Wonderful tea bar, hip and comforting spot with friendly staff! I'd definitely come back.
author: Astrid Z.

description:
It doesn't get more hipster than Samovar Tea, my favorite tea lounge, in the Mission. Great place for herbal tea and/or finding a meditation coach or drummer for your band. I truly enjoyed my first experience after visiting their Yerba Buena Gardens location a few years ago. 
They offer a number small bites, brunch & an assortment of exotic teas served in a relaxing small space. I tried their Mainichi Matcha Bowl with notes of spinach, asparagus and cut grass. I could only discern the cut grass...but loved it. I look forward to returning again.
author: Dan A.

description: Came in here really quick for a chai tea with almond milk. The smell of this place was amazing and the decor was awesome. I love how they have the chai tea in big pots and they serve it right in front of you. I wish the flavor of the chai was as good as the visual appearance of the place. The chai was definitely too much on the spicy side for my palate. I was really excited for it too because it smelt so good but the flavor just didn't deliver. I might try the regular milk instead of the almond milk and see if that changes anything.
author: Steven K.

description:
# 20 Samovar Tea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 5/5 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars 

I did not expect this place to serve milk tea  based on it's apperance b/c as others have noted it looks far too classy and boujee (that Migos song is catchy isn't it?? ...but I digress)   but they DID! They have what's called a TEST kitchen and they are making milk tea with boba.

So while I have it rated 5/5 I think they can be even higher b/c the wait staff was incredibly sweet and they are making an effort to improve. 

I hope they keep milk tea on the menu and I for sure will come back to try it out. 

Rod M tours San Francisco in search of the BEST standard milk tea with boba. I have individual reviews for all the places listed below.  Check out my latest reviews for the most up to date list. 

I recently embarked on a completely pointless quest to rank most of the Milk Tea/Boba Places in the area.

Rules: I ordered a simple milk tea with Boba (regular sweetness, ice etc.)

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top)  is my favorite/ #30  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

Rod Boba SF Rating = (Taste of Milk Tea / Taste of Tapioca Balls) on a Scale of 1 to 10 (10/10) being the best score possible
* Please note that I like my boba a little bit sweet. I don't like it too milky, too strong of a tea taste or too watery.  I prefer fresh tasting larger "boba".  Powdery drinks (those places that simply have a plastic carafe that they pour out of ) and boba that tastes "old" get docked on my rating scale. 

# 1 Itea *Rod Boba SF Rating * 9/9 *Rod's Yelp Rating *5 stars 
# 2 Puppy bobar *Rod Boba SF Rating * 8/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *5 stars

# 4 Caffee Central *Rod Boba SF Rating * 7/8 *Rod's Yelp Rating *4 stars

# 33 I Café *Rod Boba SF Rating * 3/3 *Rod's Yelp Rating *2 stars
author: Rod M.

description:
The person (who was really trying) to make my drink was obviously new and not being adequately helped by other staff. Ie. the person helping literally left to take a break mid-way through my matcha latte being made. I'm all about breaks, but the staff dynamics seemed unprofessional and toxic. 

In turn, I watched my drink be made in a haphazard way and at the end, not be made properly. It had already taken so long, I choose to just walk away but only drank a few sips because it didn't taste great. 

This was my first time to the cafe and while I loved the bright, beautiful space - I don't think I'll be back.
author: Natalie T.

description:
Came here on a Sunday afternoon and it was packed! This place is set up more as a cafe compared to the restaurant in SOMA. The tea selection is great and they have a wide assortment for you to choose from. I ordered the green ryokucha tea and it was STRONG. Would have been nice to dilute it with a bit more water to really enjoy it.

I also ordered the avocado toast and the egg jar. I wanted to order more but the person taking my order told me it would be more than enough. Unfortunately she doesn't know how much my stomach can expand, but maybe it's a good thing I took her advice.

The avo toast was good but if I went back I'd love to try the white truffle eff & avocado bowl instead. The egg jar was good but there was too much rice, I ended up throwing away a lot of rice at the bottom since it was too much.

Would definitely stop by again if I was in the area and wanted a quick and small bite!
author: Megan K.

description:
Great chai tea!! It is simmering in a copper pot right by the register. You can get it finished with a choice of almond milk or regular milk. However, just wish there was an option without a ton of added sugar. I found overly sweet.

The tea shop sells a variety of teas to take home, prices range around $15 for a small package. I bought an earl grey one to take home. I liked it, but it was a basic blend, nothing outstanding to justify the higher price.

There are a variety of treats and sandwiches you can purchase as well. There are couches and coffee tables. However, no actual table tops to get work done at. Good place to get a drink and snack to catch up with friends.
author: Nancy Q.

description:
Unfortunately not my cup of tea

Matcha latte with almond milk
- tasteless, may have just as well paid for some hot almond milk with green food coloring, I just wanted to enjoy some matcha flavor. ..is that so hard? 
- grainy, unfortunately the matcha is not super fine like it should be

Service - all workers tried to avoid eye contact for a good minute, darting their eyes away and not offering help and so I was confused whether or not to order from the cashier first or at the barista section like at Philz 

$5 for a really sturdy disposable cup of hot plain liquid and wasted time, should've got a mangonada from down the street. 2 stars for no stomach ache or outright rudeness
author: Tina A.

description: Quite possible the most overly exacerbated pretentious coffee shop I've ever had the miss fortune of stepping into. Not only do they serve toast as a a food option but it's also 6 dollars and up toast, that was just sub par. Further more I ordered a chai that was so hot I couldn't even drink it until about fifteen minutes later. In grand total two large chias and a piece of toast cost me $19 and every moment of it was the antithesis of enjoyable. I'm happy I'll never have the misfortune of getting swindled at this tea shop again.
author: Chris G.

description:
Holy smokes!
I've never stood in line OUTSIDE the door just to get a cup of chai, but oh, was it worth it!
SO good, SO satisfying, SO delicious!
I regretted not bringing a bigger container (like a gallon?) with me.
Oh yeah, you can bring your own mug and they'll happily fill it (save the Earth!).
Some drinks take a while to make because they have to be steeped, but again - so worth it.
Don't let the line scare you. It's a good bonding experience with the strangers in the city :)
author: Daria L.

description:
Am I a 24 year old successful yuppie working my way up the corporate ladder? No. Do I feel like one when I go to Samovar? 100%

The first thing I noticed when my bougie friend brought me to her favorite brunch place was the natural lighting. The light floods in and everything looks so beautiful. You'll be GLOWING! I was already in a good mood when our food came out. The avocado toast was only $6 (I realize these are huge margins but avocado toast at other places I've been are always around $9-12) and adding smoked salmon is another $6. I'm a HUGE fan of salmon and this smoked salmon may be the best I've ever had. Perfectly sliced, smoked, and salted!

Samovar is a millennial's DREAM. Please go check it out--you will not regret it!
author: Lucy A.

description:
I count myself very lucky - I used to live by the Samovar near Metreon, and now live right by the one on Valencia.

Both Samovar locations, while different, are consistently great.

The Valencia location, while smaller than the larger Yerba Buena restaurant, has an austere and warming storefront that's perfect for a relaxing visit on a weekend morning.

They offer a varied tea selection from many countries that are authentic and high quality, and a small menu of artisanal toasts and grain bowls (that come in a hipster mason jar).

Pro tip: take a Love Story Yoga class next door, then come here for a free drink.
author: Jeremy C.

description:
It's good to be here in Samovar Tea and Chai!  The first artisanal spot had been my first check in.  The reason I came here several times was to try many different healthy and pleasant tea and tea latte options.  I never once had tried Maiden's Ecstasy since pu-erh is infused with coffee.  I'm a tea lover and I have the right to choose what's comfortable unto my ceramic cup.  What I also like is having nut milk over cow's milk, an alternative healthier choice for a tea blend.

Masala chai will always be the most popular brew in everyone's cup.  Straight from the copper boiling pots, this sweet spicy beverage served quickly.  You could still smell that sweet spicy chai flavor spreading the whole white room once you open the door.  I've chosen the vegan chai, hot or iced, and it taste so good! :^}

Cold brew matcha was fine, but Matcha Bowl is more than a special drink; it's ceremonial.  In Japanese tea ceremony, a traditional bow is both before and after consumption.  The Matcha Bowl which cost $22 is the highest grade matcha.  Looking at matcha green tea through the recycled glass soup bowl after a couple of minutes is like seeing a hot tub sauna.  Spinning the soup bowl is tough since it's made of glass; ceramic should be much easier.  As for the most expensive matcha, I'm glad it's not more bitter like the one from Asha Tea House.

Sweet milk tea should be the same as HK style milk tea.  Drinking it sure takes me back to the real streets of Hong Kong.  Unlike the HK style milk teas out there, this black tea brew is blended with condensed coconut milk, and it's the best in Samovar!  Less bitter, medium sweet, and lighter color, Sweet milk tea would be a better choice than Hong Kong tea latte made with Earl Grey, jasmine, and almond milk.

If I love Samovar so much, I wanted tea lovers everywhere to feel they're right at home, where I enjoy every special cup.  The best of Samovar Tea and Chai never rest!
author: Jimmy C.

description:
Masala chai w almond milk -- One of the best chais I've had because they steep it in a big vat and so the flavors marry well. Not five stars because not as good as the chai I've had in India which has more ginger flavors . I bet there's a ton of sugar in it, but at least it doesn't taste too sweet at all. This place serves the kind of chai I'm always looking for at coffee shops. 

Tumeric latte with whole milk -- this drink comes bright yellow. I didnt think the tumeric and whole milk flavors mixed smoothly. I prefer the tumeric latte from contraband cafe

Would highly recommend. I'm def coming back and can see myself planning days around getting the chai from here
author: Jeanie N.

description:
Samovar has fantastic interior design, but little seating. 

I ordered an iced matcha latte with almond milk and it was good; quality was there and it was unsweetened just how I like it. However, everything is quite expensive - I could probably make the same thing at home. 

The honey butter toast was delicious, but a tad too sweet as it was literally doused in honey.

My friend ordered the egg jar with wild salmon; tasted amazing but pricey for eggs and salmon over rice! However, she got to keep the mason jar it was served in. 

I'd come back for a pastry and a drink - but not very often as the seating is limited and the pricing is high.
author: Monica H.

description:
What a cute little place! I have stopped by here a few times on my way to work, and the tea is always incredible. I order the almond milk chai (vegan chai, as they call it), and it is perfectly spiced and creamy. It is probably the most authentic chai I have had that isn't homemade by my mother! You can see huge vats of chai being made and the whole place smells heavenly. 

My only complaint is the lack of seating- there are some white stairs that are for sitting, but it is uncomfortable and not a good position for eating or drinking. I would recommend getting something to go!
author: Ayushi A.

description: Although expensive, their tea is so good, and the atmosphere is calm. I wouldn't necessarily whip out all my stuff and study here since there's not much of a table/outlet situation, but I would maybe read a book while I have my tea.
author: Madeleine M.

description: Top-notch spot for tea drinks, whether chai lattes or in many, many brewed varieties. The menu is truly extensive and covers black, green, white, oolong, pu-erh, and other teas. There are even small bites to nibble on here, although the main attraction is the tea, served in a modern, sparkling, science lab meets Williams-Sonoma sort of vibe. Service is also super friendly and helpful.
author: Vincent L.

description: My family has gone thru many workers over the years. Lately I give it a thumbs down. We are a Chai connoisseur family. WOW what a disappointment lately. All we see is the price keeps going up and the quality of the Chai is hit or miss. No consistency. A little job training might work. If you like water downed Chai you must go
author: Jeff O.

description:
I love loose leaf Samovar tea, so I was super excited to actually go to the tea house!  However, $5 later for a paper cup of tea (with no offer of milk or honey), I was thoroughly disappointed.  It didn't even taste like my tea was brewed strong enough.

I will continue drinking their tea, but in the comfort (and cost efficiency, using re-usable mugs) in my own home.
author: Lynn E.

description:
A little fancy shmancy, so I wasn't sure what to expect, but I had a great experience here.

Was looking for something small to snack on, and was intrigued by their mochi cakes. I've never heard of anything like 'em. They look sorta like Little Bites (#tbt elementary school snacktime :); despite knowing mochi's texture, I still thought maybe they would have a muffin-y consistency. But, nope! They're chewy and pretty dense, and have a sort of  fluffiness to them. Pro tip: they're buy two get one free! I got the Cardamom rose, maths and apple pie one. My favorite was definitely the matcha. So yummy! Glad I stumbled in here by chance.

Employees were super sweet, which was a lovely bonus. If I'm ever in the area again, I definitely wanna try their matcha boba(!!!)
author: Irina H.

description: They have a wide variety of teas. The masala chai was really good. +1 for calling it "chai" and not "chai tea" :D
author: Rakshit P.

description:
Perfect place to grab something soothing before a hectic meeting 
Got their special almond toast with Sea Salts. YUM!!!
Nice clean and relaxing music
author: elizabeth t.

description:
My go-to: Medium masala chai tea with almond milk. 

The masala chai is creamy and aromatic. There have been a handful of times where the masala chai tasted spicier than usual, but I don't mind. If you like a more toned-down chai, the downtown location does a good job at that.
author: Heather N.

description:
I struggle with Samovar because while the drinks and food are pretty good, they are absurdly priced.

The Hong Kong milk tea can be amazing when the right server makes it for you, but at times it it's sickeningly sweet. They seem to time the tea infusion, which is a nice touch. The masala chai is overspiced for me and the milk used is too fatty, but other people I've gone with seem to like it. The turmeric latte is really terrible, and I have yet to understand why people drink this with a straight face.

What really sinks it is the prices. They have gone up significantly in the past year. When I started going to Samovar the small masala chai was $4.25 (in fact, this is the price listed on their website www.samovartea.com/lounges/samovar-tea-var-menu/) which is already really high (nearby Pakwan has $1 chai). The price is now $5. The egg jar used to be $9, with salmon (again, this is what's listed on their online menu). Now it's over $10 and often isn't even filled up all the way.

And that's where it becomes insufferable. Samovar gives off a very peace-love vibe while in fact being ruthlessly capitalist. I guess nirvana is only achievable by those who can drop five bucks on a cup of tea.
author: Anita J.

description:
This place is amazing!  Even if you're a newbie to tea, you would still appreciate the delicate flavors that mesh well into a soothing and satisfying feeling!  Seriously, one sip and you immediately have that "ahhhh" feeling.   We tried the iced black rose, which was a perfect sweetness; the green ecstasy, which started bitter but smoothed itself out in your mouth; and the ginger tumeric tea, which was a sip of melting butter despite the overtones of tumeric!

And, the best part was the service!   Amber was a ray of sunshine in a very frustrating day!  She was super helpful and very generous with her suggestions.  Additionally, the GF Mochi Cakes were umptious!  Yes, I said umptious!  My word for WOW!  We tried the chocolate, chai, and coconut date.  If you've ever had Filipino babingka, that's what the coconut date cake tastes like.  After we tried them, we had to go back for more to bring home!  Amber very generously put some in a bag for me at no charge as it was close to their closing time!  I couldn't believe her act of kindness!  

How I wished we had a place like this in southern Ca
author: E F.

description:
Best tea in the city. Great selection.
However, the formally delicious mochi cake treats are no longer delicious - the recipe changed and they are inedible - dry and tasteless. Bring back the original recipe!
author: Kelli S.

description:
Usually this place is good and is one of the few tea places around. However, they couldn't be more inconsistent with service and quality. From skipping or messing up orders to having poor quality food about 1/5 of the time. 

Today I went in to get the mochi cakes. I love the mochi cakes. However the mochi cakes today were totally dry flowery and really not the same as usual. Like it seems like they have twice as much flower and half as much mochi and they are really inedible. I'm annoyed and frustrated and more angry that I'm, frankly not surprised. 

At least can you do quality control of your baked goods!!!!  

I told a barista about the mochi cakes and he mentioned more were coming tomorrow and there is a new pastry chef training or something. That is no excuse for selling inedible food that has been tasty in the past. I feel ripped off.
author: Alex L.

description: Samovar without the seating area, essentially to-go, loses a lot of its charm -- it means you wait for a while on a line instead of while seated at a table. On a nice day, the parklet outside is a good option for when you've finally secured your hot drink. The bathroom was clean, though access to it was treacherous -- staff occasionally bring down a ladder next to it, and if you have the misfortune to enter when it's up, then try to exit when it's down, you may have trouble getting out!
author: Carl B.

description:
My first visit here was wonderful. The guy working there was really nice -- great customer service. I sampled their masala chai and Rosie Palmer, which were both good. Not sweet at all if you're into that. 

I settled on the green ecstasy (iced) since it was a warm day, (thank you Mission's microclimate). 

Came back and tried the matcha cold brew which comes in a mason jar, also pretty good, but seeing how it was created made me have second thoughts since she used water from the sink..
author: Jamila W.

description: Their tea was wonderful and the way they make the chai in copper tins is amazing! And the woman who works there is amazing and knowledgable!
author: amir y.

description: I came here with a friend waiting for a table to open up at Pica Pica. Glad I brought her here! Great ambiance, very calming, as you would expect a tea shop to be. I told the barista at the counter that I was sick with congestion and looking for something that coke help alleviate it. He gave me a spearmint sage that was excellent. They also had a "tester" pumpkin chai at the counter and it was AMAZING. I believe this place could make any coffee person a tea person. I just wish there was more sitting space
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
Yeahhhh, this place is pretty hipster. $5 chai & tea options, $10 rice bowls served in mason jars, limited seating leaning up against the wall. 

Still though, I enjoy the masala chai. They make two batches with either whole or almond milk. Depending on the milk, the chai will taste pretty different. You can ask for samples. 

For their golden turmeric milk- they recently changed the recipe so it's slightly sweeter. They added coconut milk, so think of a strained curry sauce in a drink like form. I personally like the newer version. 

Suitable place for a drink and small bite. Don't expect to plunker down here for hours- the setting isn't conducive for that. You can people watch and see the staff do their chai making thang- while enjoying the simplistic, modern interior design.
author: Joanna L.

description: Amber - you were the color of my energy today! I had multiple people recommend for me to come here on a visit to San Francisco. I came hungry and Amber made the most wonderful greens bowl for me. She asked questions about what to include in it and I could feel her love energy all the way through it. I felt so happy and grateful that I gave her a hug. I will definitely return for some tea!
author: Jana B.

description:
Another fantastic artisanal spot on Valencia that is quintessentially San Franciscan with
- fusion of east and west
- great ambience of trendy eastern music still accessible to hipster crowd
- great design elements with earthy, open and airy feel

On food, I had the egg jar with runny egg, salmon, microgreen and brown rice (cooked just right with a bit of soy sauce) for a great breakfast/-afternoon snack concoction, served in a mason jar. Good balance of flavor and texture. 

I also had the turmeric spice tea, served in a cup customized for samovar by atelier dion in Oakland. Definitely with spicy and earthy flavor to wake one's senses. 

I get the mochi minis from time to time. If the texture is hard (like a muffin) vs soft mochi, it means that it was from the day before (beaware when they are offering three for two pricing). Not great - they will return if you ask them. Best to ask if they are freshly made for that day. 

The design of the place is ingenious with a middle counter that serves as a hangout counter to place one's tea for the standing crowd and a divider of the waiting crowd vs. already served crowd. A bi-level long sitting section is against the wall to create symmetry and division at the same time. Very creative to maximize the usage of a small space while still retaining its artisanal and cozy feel without being on top of each other. 

More for a one person stopover or leisurely two-people gathering rather than larger group spot.
author: Rebecca C.

description: I love coffee, but I've also come to appreciate the flavors and pairings of tea - especially green tea! I loved their take on mochi and their selection of teas is really impressive.  The Green Ecstasy was light but flavorful and perfect for a sunny day.  So happy to have found this place!
author: Christine T.

description:
The store is super cute -- has all the clean hipster vibes.

The avocado toast was disappointing. I much prefer the ones I make myself. The honey toast was alright though -- but beware long haired folks! Don't eat outside on a windy day.. or be in for a mess! 

The egg jar was phenomenal. I loved all the flavours and textures in the egg jar! Have yet been able to replicate my own.. 

Beware though.. I waited ~30 minutes for my tea and avocado toast! To be fair, I may have hit a busy time but it's still ridiculous how long the wait was.
author: Denise K.

description:
We will not seat you until your entire party is here.  Then when our party all showed up we had to wait while they cleaned a table.  We were out for Sunday brunch, and they had plenty of tables.  Just seat people, they might order more tea and appetizers, and give better reviews
The sandwich I had was good, the borscht was not.  The teas are excellent.  The service staff was very nice.
author: Francis C.

description:
Phenomenal!! We got the masala chai, turmeric coconut latte and the PB & j mochi (along with other Mochi samples).
The spot is minimal in a beautiful, artsy way. The food and drink are all presented and made with a ton of intention and consciousness. 
The barista was helpful!! Answered my questions and gave me leftover latte to try :)
author: Jennifer M.

description: Ambiance is beautiful, tea is amazing. But the price for the egg jar considering the amount of food is very disappointing and I feel like a bobo for returning and hoping the ratios would improve. Mostly rice, less than a teaspoon of the salmon. I'll be making my own from now on :(
author: E E.

description: This is the best chai tea EVER (well, at least in America)! I am a chai tea officionado. Don't hesitate to come here.
author: Frieda B.

description:
Parking: metered parking (or if you can walk, walk).

Ambience: pretty intimate since it's very small. Limited seating, but on a nice day, it's nice to hang out outside

I've had avocado toast once, but I rather make my own at home because 1. it's simple and 2. it's not really worth it to get it here. It's nothing that special or exotic hence ding a star.

If you want more food options, the Yerba Buena location is best. This location serves mostly tea. It's also better to drink there instead of ordering to-go as my Matcha Bowl was way smaller when she gave it to me in a to-go cup. Last time I came and sat inside, I had a bigger portion. Quality wise, I love the Matcha. It tastes bold and authentic - real Matcha right here. Not your BS powder you get from Starbucks, Peets, or Whole Foods.
author: Cheri C.

description:
I went to Samovar Tea on Sat 3/12/16 and had to wait a bit in line.  I wanted the regular marsala chai and the lady said they didn't have anymore and let me try the vegan marsala chai made from almond milk.  It tasted fine and would have gotten it, then she looked again and managed to get me a cup of the regular marsala chai - not filled up to the top though.  Cost was $4.25 for the cup.

It tasted ok, but at the end lots of leaves were in my cup and I had to keep taking it out of my mouth.  That was gross.

She kept telling people no more marsala chai though there was a huge full pot and it would take a while to make.  

The matcha tea that they make with a giant machine looked cool.  Maybe I should try that next time.

One unisex bathroom that you need a code, when I went it was 33553 or something like that.  The sink has the water, then on the sides is the hand dryer!  First time I've seen that.  Kinky Japanese erotic art on the ceiling in red!  Aiya!
author: Ann L.

description:
I wanted to love this place. The high quality ingredients, the fair prices, and the fun vibe. Sadly, my experience was somewhat ruined by a few things:

- the grumpy pill that every staff member must have taken before coming to work. Is it too much to ask for a smile? Or to at least appear like you give a damn? After admitting it was my first time, the staffer didn't even bother so much as a "welcome" and continued to respond to my questions as if I was a total idiot. At one point, I even felt compelled to apologize for having questions. That in itself is enough for me to not come back. 

- the avocado toast was well-priced and I loved the gluten free SRSLY Sourdough bread option! While I was impressed they used Maldon Salt, there was none to be found. I returned to ask for some and realized why I couldn't taste anything -- they are using a salt shaker for the salt. Everyone who uses Maldon knows, you have to crush the coarsely chunky salt between your fingers to get the full taste benefits of this lovely salt. Eating my toast was like a Russian Roulette of taste -- some bites had a chunk of salt, most did not. Sad face. 

- my order was for here but both my chai and my toast were served in crappy takeout containers. On that note, the lids to their coffee cups don't fit well and I witnessed many people (including myself) struggling to make them fit without leaking. 

- the chai was very nice ... once it cooled down to a normal hot drink temperature. I love the presentation of the big copper pots but perhaps they need to have better monitoring of the temps. I burned myself with the first sip and it took 15 minutes before I could actually drink it. 

All in all, this place could be great but it needs new or improved staff/company culture and some minor logistical adjustments. If people hate coming to work that bad, it makes you wonder what's going on behind the scenes.
author: Natasha D.

description:
Super cute and hipster tea shop! A bit on the pricier end for a small drink but the vibe is what makes the place so wonderful! It feels very zen in here and it smells great. 

Unfortunately, there is only one really long bench with tiny tables (that could pass as footrest), so it isn't the best place to do large group gatherings at. However it is perfect for solo work (if you don't mind not having a table) or chatting with one or two people. 

I got the sweet milk tea. Excellent tea flavor. It wasn't too sweet and didn't just taste like sugar, which is very refreshing. I definitely also recommend the matcha Latte. It's not very sweet and has a strong matcha flavor. Very delicious!
author: Melinda L.

description: Update: the staff have become so "over it" and rude, and the prices keep climbing. This place is no longer my favorite.
author: Sara O.

description:
I love this place.

But please do our world a favor and have 3 bins!! I hate seeing all garbage going to the same bin.

Please, make me love you even more!
author: Maggie J.

description:
This is quite a fancy looking tea place, and I'm really glad to have a nice place dedicated to teas rather than coffee; There are only few tea houses compared to coffee houses! The regular chai was good (super hot though! Was a while before we could drink it.) I also had the Hong Kong milk tea, which was interesting. It was mildly sweet even without sugar and without the flavour of the Indian spices that chai has. 

The place is advertised as inexpensive (single $ sign) here on Yelp, but for $5 a chai it's a lot more expensive than most other places! It has a good amount of seating and a very clean, code-locked bathroom. The service was a little slow but polite. We could taste the chai, but none of the other items on the menu. Would have been great to have tasters for some of the unique items on the menu, to know what you might like before you spend the dough on it. But apart from the lack of tasting options, it's a nice place to stop by for tea!

PS: There is seating along the wall but no tables, so not very conducive to sitting here and working!
author: Nilay P.

description:
One of the few stores I've found that offers pure matcha tea.  They have 3 different levels of matcha purity going up in price.  I also like how they have rose tea which I haven't found too many places either. It can be ordered cold in an Arnold Palmer (Rose Palmer) or hot which tastes wonderful with some added milk.

Their small menu includes lite bites as well as having some sweets that are mostly gluten free.  I'd highly recommend their avocado toast which comes on thick bread and is only $5 which is actually pretty good considering how expensive avocados can be. 

1 star off because while Samovar is an aesthetically pretty store the seating is sparse and uncomfortable. The white concrete (?)  benches which I think are trying to capture a clean minimalist look kinda remind me of eating lunch on benches at the Acropolis or a very clean construction site.  Hard, uncomfortable, and not the most conducive for eating food.  They are also awkward how it faces the front counter though you do get a clear view of the staff making teas and food if you care. Thank God, a new parklet was recently installed right outside so there is more seating available there.
author: Joan W.

description:
Wow!
This place is fantastic!
Great trendy & modern atmosphere. Nice people working here. Free samples. Small menu but looks for real as well... What not to like!
My husband & I got the traditional chai tea... Amazing!! It was full of flavor & spice, just what we need with this cold weather that is upon us!
There were 4 samples available also. We tried the oolong, monkey picked tea & it was one of the best I've ever had!
They have a small but decent sized area to sit & chat or read a book.
We will definitely be back & will try one of their food items, the avocado toast looked great! 
They also sell a limited selection of their loose tea leaves.
author: Ashley G.

description:
Best Tea Ever! I went in this morning to grab a tea and I just experienced the most amazing customer service. Amber was attentive, kind, thoughtful. I wish their was more Amber's in this world. A great cup of tea with stellar customer service! Best place hands down. 

Thank you amazing Samovar staff for making my day.
author: Amanda F.

description: We stopped here after dinner at Burma Love and what a treat. I ordered the cocoa and mint tea and it was so yummy. Really loved it. When waiting we asked what was in the steaming pots and they said almond milk chai and they gave us each a small cup. Wow! So amazing. My husband isn't much of a chai fan and yet he is still talking about it. It was a cold night so it was just so perfect. The service was very good and overall we had a great experience here.
author: Lisa H.

description: The tea makers are very professional. I tried the Matcha green tea latte and it was very good. But their matcha cakes were not so worth trying.
author: Niu L.

description:
Hands down all around great place! Friendly girl at front gave us samples of chai. The best home brewed chai with option of Almond milk. 
Great selection of tea from around the world. Tea latte they brew by hand or water based with fresh loose teas. Small seating area but this is SF after all :P
I could hang out here all day
author: Renukah H.

description:
Whoa. 

I like my Masala chai tea with a side of swank please.

The beautiful, all white environment is cooling to the senses. Your eyes will zero in on the big copper pots simmering with Masala chai and since we're in SF, you can even have almond milk with it.

Test tubes containing loose leaf, single origin, organic teas appeal to the science nerd in me. Try the traditional English Breakfast or a caffeine free version like Spearmint Sage. 

Unlike other Samovar locations, this one is more of a to-go place rather than a lounge. However, the set-up fits the Mission and I'm happy to have an alternative to the coffee shop dominated stretch of Valencia st.
author: Janice C.

description:
Samovar tea (this location in particular) has easily become of my favorite places in the city! It's cute, super hipster and has a great matcha drink with delicious eats!

Eats.
+Egg jar. Salmon, sous vide egg & microgreens on top of brown organic rice. I added avocado for an additional $2 (worth it). Mmmm.. this delicious meal kept me energized for a good amount of the day.

Drank.
+Matcha ecstasy. Mmmm.. I love matcha and this drink was perfect. I make matcha latte's everyday so wanted to try something they were known for. I could see why this drink is so popular.

The egg jar and matcha drink? Just amazing, simply amazing. I saw others eating avocado with toast and even that looked devine.. maybe it's the egg. Dang those sexy sous vide eggs!

Seating is against the wall. I stayed for about 30 mins or so and everyone that was there before/after me had already left.
author: Beverly E.

description: The best chai tea in the Bay. Great location and cute interior. My only complaint is that when it gets really crowded the baristas don't adjust the volume on the stereo. I'm here right now and it's just a cacophony. If this wasn't a problem I'd give it a 5 star rating.
author: Jann R.

description: This review is for the SFO International Terminal location.  I was so excited to find it at SFO.  Got the turmeric coconut milk latte which is my favorite @ Samovar.  So disappointing.  It was so bland. It's as if they just sprinkled some cinnamon powder on warm coconut milk.  The color was off as well.  What happened?
author: Mei S.

description:
Only in the mission can you get a green tea shot, then upon exiting immediately run into a woman who hands you a sunflower ( I kid you not, see the pic), says you're cute, then runs away giggling like a teenager.

Just like that random sunflower, I didn't know what to think when I saw this place.

It looks like Beaker and Bunsons laboratory from the Muppets.

Except they make high quality tea here.

Glass beakers, whisks, vats of liquid chai tea, it's an interesting set up for sure.

The matcha shot was very strong, and though it didn't wake me up (I'm not a morning person), it did taste healthy. 

I felt very distinguished drinking here. I felt like I was made of money. Well, I guess maybe I am since it costs nearly $5 for one shot of matcha that doesn't have any alcohol in it.

And afterwards I walked out onto crazy mission street where that girl gave me one sunflower from her batch of flowers, and ran away.

I wanted to ask her what she meant by "cute." I had a Joe Pesci in Goodfella's kind of moment where I wanted to ask her, "cute as in a puppy cute? Cute, as in funny looking? What do you mean by cute?"

But, I never got the chance since she ran away. 

Only in the mission I tell you, can this type of thing happen.....
author: Jack R.

description:
Delicious. Friendly. And expensive. 

You have the little parklette outside to hang. Food is good. Avocado truffle toast, the egg jar is awesome as well. 

They recently raised their prices and cut their portions. It used to be incredible because it was the only place in SF you could find $5 avocado toast, but alas that dream is dead. 

If you're a local, ask for the discount.
author: Myrna P.

description: The past couple times I have been to the Mission, I've made a point to stop by here. I love this place for the quick service and their yummy masala chai. It's the perfect level of spiciness for me and I add some honey to up the sweetness level. Definitely a fan and I plan on stopping by the next time I'm in the Mission!
author: Jessica R.

description:
This grab-and-go samovar location has a nice parklet you can sit at in front. I was feeling adventurous that day so I ordered:
 - turmeric latte
 - miso tahini toast
 - black sesame mochi muffin

This was a very interesting and strange blend of flavors. The black sesame made the muffin quite dry but the chewiness of the mochi flour was nice. The turmeric latte was very yellow (watch out for drip stains!) and had a complex, hard-to-describe flavor. The toast is probably the only item I would order again, but it is quite salty
author: Jenny K.

description:
I really love this place. They have excellent chai--you can smell it from the street--as well as many flavors of green and black tea. My favorite herbal tea is the turmeric spice, which I bought in bulk to prepare at home. They will let you sample many of the teas before you buy.

They have delicious food. Wonderful avocado toast with truffle oil, some other dish that has eggs and avocado and greens-- I can't remember the name but I've had it many times--several flavors of little bread muffins that are flavored like matcha and other teas. So good. 

My only complaint is that sometimes the staff has forgotten my food order-- but both times when I reminded them they were very apologetic and fixed it immediately. Another time they made my food to go when I was planning on staying. All three of these experiences were several months ago-- when I went yesterday they were totally on top of their game. But maybe be direct and pay attention when you order.
author: Ryan E.

description: I have loved Samovar for a long time, in many different locations. Their coconut turmeric latte is delicious. That said, the gal working the counter was more interested in processing a relationship with her coworker than taking & making my order. Always a wait, and that's fine, it's usually worth it...
author: Olive L.

description: Never being in this place. My friend recommended as we were nearby for dinner. As I step into the store, I already started getting the Chai spices smell. Ordered the Chai Almond milk Tea. Definitely it delivered in taste as I was expecting from its fragrant spices. Well balanced. Place is very nice for chatting. We got almost at closing time and they offered customers their mochi bites for free!
author: Quiz Men C.

description: Amaaaazing baristas and fantastic chai out of big brass barrel things. I got the almond milk and it was spicier and delicious !
author: Riz J.

description: Good tea here. I'm not a chai drinker, but my wife is, and she said it was really good. I had the Bai Mudan white tea. It was made very well. It was made with the right temp water, and stepped for an appropriate amount of time. It made for a very refreshing drink.
author: Joseph J.

description:
Pricey, but delicious. I love the almond milk chai!
The space itself is gorgeous.
author: Mimi C.

description: Will preface by saying that food, drink, and atmosphere are all quite lovely. What I cannot get over is how long it takes to get your order, especially given the quick nature of preparing their menu. Tea may come out within the first five minutes, but it's unclear why it doesn't just get poured and served immediately. We ordered a few plates of food once (their Miso toast and a Poached Egg+Avocado toast) and it took just under half an hour to get it. Seating is very limited in this Samovar, so expect to take your drink to go.
author: Michelle L.

description:
We came here late afternoon for a light snack. It's a trendy place - we sat outside, the weather was beautiful and there was music nearby. It's a good place to catch up with friends, chat or read a book. The food is solid, but expensive considering what you get. There was a lot of issues with the service - by no means was our waitress rude, but they assigned us to a table where the waitress' shift was supposed to end in 30 minutes. It took us 20 minutes to get a small refill of hot water (this was even after talking to three people). It took us many calls to get our bill and it took them 20 minutes to return our card back to us (meanwhile our waitress was chatting in the back and another waiter was ready to ask us to leave...without our card). 

We had the Taiwanese Iron Goddess of Mercy oolong tea for $10. It was nice and I believe it would be interesting for someone not familiar with traditional ways of making tea, especially the way they show you how to make the tea. But as someone who has had tea service in Taiwan, the tea experience was meh and the spout used to pour the tea has no filter, which is kind of sub-par. We got the Ginger-Quinoa Waffle ($12), the Quiche with a side of beet soup, and toast with poached eggs. The food was decent for the prices (but nothing special), but the service was a complete mess.
author: Shihyung H.

description: My favorite chai tea ever !!! I'm an avid chai drinker and I literally have never tasted Christmas in my mouth like I did when I came to Samovar. The customer service was on point too. Wish there was more seating because I would spend more time here!
