description: The place smells amazing and the avocado toast was one of the most delicious things I've had in San Francisco. However, the guy who works there has a really bad attitude problem. It felt like he was doing me a favor when I put in my order. When I put back my plate and said thank you he looked away and gave me no response. Feel bad for this place because I loved it otherwise. With that kind of service I wouldn't recommend my friends to go.
author: Oscar W.

description: I'm in love with Samovar Mission's decor about as much as their masala chai tea, pre-brewed in giant copper pots.  Now, if only they had seating!
author: Joanne G.

description: Obviously very good quality teas and chais but keep in mind this is not the best ace to hang out and enjoy your tea and get some work done.  Their tea lounges/other locations are much much better for that.  The experience all around is better there
author: Sonam J.

description: I am currently kind of obsessed with this place.  May be the awesome smell of chai that permeates the entire place; or that they have perfect vegan chai; or the matcha. Mochi cake.  Their lunch in a jar is so good too. Or the zen atmosphere. Uff, Wish I lived a bit closer!
author: Vivian P.

description:
Samovar on Valencia St. is my morning stop on the way to work. They have the best Chai i've ever tasted. Have it hot or cold, vegan or with whole milk - simply amazing any way you have it. It is made from scratch with a bag of herbs and is warmed in a big pot on a stove. I'm also known for being addicted to their rosy palmer which is a fancier more delicious version of the Arnold palmer (+rose water!) 

Their staff is warm and friendly and they all give excellent customer service. They never seemed stressed or rushed, which is a relief first thing in the morning. One of their employees, Saul, goes above and beyond in his customer service. It seems like he has made friends with everyone on the street. There are times when I go by just to chat with him, and I'm usually not the only one. 

The space itself is simplistic yet beautiful. They have large jars of herbs on display, terrariums, and the machines they use to make their tea, well i've never seen anything quite like them. Samovar is the Four Barrel of Tea and I'm absolutely in love.
author: Chelsea C.

description:
Great concept, friendly staff, and high quality tea. And the scones are tasty.

However, the seating is really limited and weirdly laid-out, so it's not very comfortable to sit in there with your tea. It's not a huge space but it seems to be poorly designed, even taking that into consideration.

As another reviewer has pointed out, some of the teas/chais come pre-sweetened and they are too sweet. Why not let people sweeten themselves to taste?

Also be aware of the short hours -- they close at 7pm every day of the week. That's earlier than other neighborhood grab-and-go spots like Four Barrel, Stanza, and Muddy Waters).
author: David C.

description: This place is awesome. Super cool design. Best iced matcha latte I've ever had. Staff was so kind and informative. I feel like I got a private lesson on how to make my own matcha at home. Awesome experience and true local gem.
author: Sarah K.

description: Such delicious chai!! and they have a vegan version with almond milk. 'nough said.
author: Dominique F.

description: Based on the attitude of the person at the cash register, I decided not to buy anything.  When I said I wanted a matcha that was not super grassy, she said "I don't understand.  They are all grassy."  No kidding.  She seemed completely disinterested in telling me the price of tea. When I asked for the price of matcha, she said "it is really expensive."  Yeah, but what is the price?  When she did tell me the price, she was so fast, muttering the price under her breath, that I could not even get it.  I gave it another try and said I was looking for tea to go and prepare at home, she told me they did not sell matcha like that, but there was a bag of matcha right there, ready to buy and take home.  They also sell it online.  Bad attitude takes clients away.  I'll go and buy really expensive tea elsewhere.
author: Mister M.

description: Iced Pu-erh (on a hot day).....The most refreshing, flavorful tea imaginable.....brewed right before you eyes.  Samovar, any location, is the best place in SF for tea.
author: Bleep S.

description: What a gorgeous place.  Best chai in the city, a robust and penetrating spice. Careful though, it is served super duper hot!   The nicest tearistas (is that a word?) in the city!
author: Sandra M.

description: Beautiful space with aromatic tea!!! Very impressed with the "tea bar" idea. They make their chai from scratch, wish they would make a caffeine-free kind!!!
author: rebecca c.

description: Both San Francisco nob hill & Albuquerque no hill have very zen-like tea shop.. Samovar Tea & The Fragrant Leaf Tea Boutique.. search for it.. both are beautiful & nice
author: Ryan B.

description: Rosie Palmer is my favorite ! It's so good! And the staffs are super nice! Too bad they don't serve coffee :(
author: Nari An M.

description: really excellent chai, available in a variety of milks, almond milk, etc. ladeled into your cuppa from a big copper pot. Super clean minimal design with a few places to pop  a squat while you sip. Also delicious baked goodies like a flourless molten chocolate lava cake and some lemony cake as well - all excellent with charming service.
author: B S.

description: Tea is great, wall of windows is beautiful. Ambiance is nice. Food is standard and overpriced. But the nail in the coffin was the service. P R E T E N T I O U S. Everything for me and my guest was an issue. I would have given this place 3-4 stars had the servers not looked at me like he wanted to chop my head off when I changed my tea order before he rang it in.
author: Alex L.

description:
Very nice chai tea! It's the only place where I preferred to drink tea to coffee.
the interior design i also very nice and simple which makes it so cool.
author: Julie K.

description: Went there once and thought it was OKAY. Nothing to brag about, had a masala chai tea and honestly it's pretty expensive for what I got. I've had better tasting chai at my friend's house. The place is really cute, no tables though. It's more of a "fou fou" cafe if you ask me..
author: Neena T.

description: Amazing place. Stunning fit out and delicious tea. I had the chai, with a raisin and orange water cookie.  Perfect for a cold San Fran day!
author: Lisa P.

description: I don't drink coffee but I always hear how great cold coffee brews are. So I was excited to see that this tea bar has a matcha cold brew. I love matcha and I didn't hesitated to pay $6. Here is the recipe how to make a $6 worth matcha cold brew: take ice in a mason jar, add a scoop of matcha powder-GO TO THE SINK AND FILL IT UP WITH TAP WATER, shake well and off you go! Really, tap water from a sink???
author: Dr. Cordula K.

description:
Love this place. The tea is delicious, the staff really friendly - and the space is nice (very modern & different than their other spaces, but it works for their new "to go" concept).

When I asked about a larger selection of baked goods to accompany the tea, they added a bunch of scones & pastries.

The chai is delicious - but I do wish it were less sweet. And I really wish they offered an iced version for hot days (I know it's not authentic that way, but things evolve). I've been told that one of the staff will ice it for you, but whenever I've asked, I was met with a blank stare... That being said, TRY IT - both versions - I'm in no way a vegan, but their vegan version is just as delicious as the milky kind.
author: judah m.

description: Best vegan chai and regular chai I ever had!! Very wholesome and freshly made in front of us. Looks like an Apple Store. I even love their snacks, extremely addicting. I could drink their chais every morning for the rest my life :)
author: Brian P.

description: Amazing vegan chai w coconut and almond milk brewed in large old school copper cauldrons. Beautiful minimalist design. Don't expect chill out cushions and vibe of other samovars - more of a to go spot. Big fan and plan to go regularly!
author: Elana R.

description: Hands down best tea and tea experience EVER! Both locations that I have been to ( Yerba Buena Garden & the Mission) are experts in their craft and offer the best of the best!
author: Eileen M.

description: I've been a huge fan of the Samovar tea lounges for a while now, so I was very excited when they launched this concept. I recommend trying the rosie palmer on hot days, it's really delicious. The baristas are really friendly and more importantly, friendly to my dog and I love that it's easy to tie him up outside where he also has a water bowl. The only complaint is that I do wish Samovar would offer a solution that was more like this than the tea lounges, but with tables so that I could sit down and get some work done for a few hours. If they did, I'd throw away my starbucks gold card in a hot second.
author: Vilde E.

description: This is my design heaven. Amazing minimalist interior and delicious chai tea served from brass cauldrons.
author: Ariel L.

description: I found this place by chance when looking for a nice outside location for lunch. This was way beyond what I had expected! I loved the options to pair a tea with your meal, and the hosting staff was very accommodating when I wished to stay longer after my meal and enjoy sipping on another ginger tea flavor. I lost track of time and had to run, so they put my remaining tea in a portable cup and topped it off with some more hot water. I will surely be back during my next San Francisco visit! Thank you!
author: Jessica A.

description: Such a beautiful relaxing location. I love the pots & the way they serve the tea. Great in windy weather
author: Laura E.

description: Great Chai but it is over priced. The ambiance is great. I like coming here and have my chai to go. The service is great. The desserts are a little overpriced. And they definitely don't have coffee!
author: Emma B.

description: Srsly, $4.75 for a cup of chai? Go around the corner to Pakwan and get delicious chai for $1.
author: Muhammad H.

description: Stopped by twice in the past couple of months. NO EARL GREY = NO 5 STARS. English breakfast was as good as any other premium tea. The banana caramel doughnut (from Mr Holmes Bakehouse) was ridiculous. The tea is made using some unique method. Pretty cool. Atmosphere is nice. No tables but they have benches.
author: Alex V.

description: Really great chai. Full of spices and the flavor lingers in your mouth. I'm curious about the Hong Kong latte.
author: Sunny C.

description: Beautiful decor here, very simplistic and stands out from the rest of the street. I ordered the traditional chai tea and while it had great flavour it was a bit watery for my taste. I've definitely had better in SF. Some of their baked goods look really good though, I haven't tried them though.
author: Vikram N.

description: I'm more a coffee type,but this beautiful establishment has caught my eyes for months and Four Barrel was a zoo so I went for it. Welcoming staff.Really love the clean minimalist decor.Got a tea that was told was comparable to the strength of coffee.I don't think I agree after consuming it,but it was very delicious .Next time I come in may try the Matcha.
author: Lauren V.

description: They don't have food like the other locations, but if you just need a cup of tea or tea leaves and maybe a bathroom and place to sit for a bit, then its perfect!
author: Jeanine I.

description: Such a cute little tea place! They have a wide variety of different flavors and almost all of them can be iced. I don't drink coffee so it's hard to find a place that has really good, unique tea flavors. There's also this really hot guy who works there, Nathan, be sure to ask for him.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Love the idea of this place, the tea was ok, will definitely go back for lunch sometimes.
author: Margaret L.

description: I'm a big fan of Samovar, and have enjoyed every location in SF.  So I was excited to see their new space.  It's really beautifully designed, and their tea-brewing machines are very cool to watch (and brew a great cup of tea).  My only criticisms are of their vegan chai and iced teas.  Their vegan chai was really over-sweetened, and they sweeten all their iced teas.  I'd much prefer adding sweetener after ordering.
author: Francesca G.

description: Your Chai tea is off the chart.  Very fresh and I liked the options of vegan Chai tea.  Definitely will come back.
author: Tkd K.

description: One look into this quiet little tea place and you'll be dying to go inside. The first thing that struck me upon entering was simply how lovely the decor was. The bright white interior, complete with beautiful wood and stone, was enough for me to rate it five stars. The bar area looked clean and organized. I ordered a masala chai for $4.50 and it was a delicious treat. It was heating in a large copper pot that was ladled into a cup for my enjoyment. They had a variety of other teas to try but the chai smelled too good for me to pass up. I took a seat and enjoyed the ambiance while I waited for my chai to cool down. It was a quiet morning and for some time I was the only person other than the two very nice employees. I thoroughly enjoyed the Asian music and the relaxing decor. I highly recommend this cute little place if you ever want a well brewed tea. I am sure that anyone, from a newbie like me to a tea expert, would find something they'd love at Samovar!
author: Juliana B.

description: Chai is great, service is meh even at un-crowded hours.  Blonde lady behind the counter seemed like she didn't want to be there, I was the only person there and she still messed up my order.
author: E G.

description: Try the Rosie Palmer. It's like an Arnold Palmer made with Rose water. It's delicious! I haven't had anything quite like it.
author: Amanda K.

description: Hot masala chai! They really do it right. I could drink this everyday! Delicious but a bit pricey but it's the hipster Mission.
author: Dora L.

description: This is a beautiful place. The tea is delicious and the staff are darling. Why only 4 stars? I'd like a wider variety of options. I've stopped in each of the last 3 days, intent on making it a daily habit, but as it turns out the teas don't change often (if at all.) I'll keep at it, but I would really like to see a greater selection of (herbal/caffeine free) teas.
author: Jason Paul S.

description:
In a city filled with an endless variety of coffee concoctions produced by the finest hipsters on the west coast, at Samovar emerges a lonesome but valued purveyor of chai.  

This is as close to authentic chai from a public vendor as I have found outside of Indian merchants and I'd say better than many of even those.  

Their chai that distinguishes itself from the artificially flavored and sweetened toxic waste offered by others.  Most people think chai is a flavor.  In reality it's lovingly crafted fresh spices and milk that is prepared with samadhi or whatever nonsense you learned at yoga class. But you don't have to be a pretend yogi Indian loving hippy to enjoy chai.    

Come as who you are.  Solve your personality and relationship problems and have a cup today.
author: Jermaine K.

description: Great cup of masala chai! I love how they have a vegan option - made with almond milk instead of dairy. The chai is aromatic and so flavorful. The spices really stand out. I knocked off one star because it was too sweet for my taste.
author: Sammie B.

description: Space is beautiful. Wish it had more high table tops. But great place to grab a tea and go. Also great place to sample each tea before you buy. Unique layout and setup from all the other samovars. Follow the Chai smell.
author: Augusto M.

description: I really like this place. I wish some of the seats were more cushiony but the chai is great and I love their duck and kale dish! It does get busy and loud sometimes but it's a great neighborhood place.
author: Shirley S.

description: Ordered the Yerba Buena and it was nothing short of amazing. The presentation is lovely, and seating is perfect if you want to hang for a few to enjoy your tea. The staff was helpful in providing details in what makes their processing of the tea so unique. Definitely planning on visiting before again before I leave town
author: Jeri M.

description: The food was really good but the service was terrible. We needed separate checks and they had a very difficult time doing that. The location was beautiful!
author: Melissa H.

description: What a refreshing (literally and figuratively) stop for tea!  Served both hot and cold, there is an assortment of teas you can choose from.  I ordered the spearmint tea, cold, and it was the perfect drink I needed after a heavy brunch.
author: Anna V.

description: The masala chai is some crazy addictive deliciousness. Honestly the best I've had in SF. Lovely staff too- love this place!
author: Bonnie C.

description: Everything is great, but the Rosy Palmer is all you need! The teas, ambiance, and people here are the best.
author: Mike D.

description: Nice, elegant tea house in the heart of the mission. Their teas are more so on the traditional side. They brew the tea leaves using some fancy brewer that injects bubbles and warm water into the clear brewing chamber. I'm sure you can Google how they actually work. I got the matcha and it was relatively smooth and tasty. One can pick up hints of wheat and other aromas. Serving temperature was on point, not too hot otherwise tea leaves burn and give off misleading aromas. Price point is slightly on the higher end for me, but then again this may be normal for a traditional tea brew house. We don't have a place as elegant as this in SJ, mostly Vietnamese boba tea houses. The mission is a trendy spot, especially near 16th streets and so forth, very artistic. I saw an artist creating something on the side of a building a few doors down, and people literally gathered to look. An artist's haven, good quality tea for the artistically inclined. No proper seating inside. Solid 4 stars.
author: Michael M.

description: This place is so chill and the vibes are nice, but there no place to lounge and enjoy. It's so pricy for a tea spot. While it markets itself as authentic and knowledgable about the various chai and tea, it's more a hipster appropriation of tea traditions and cultures. I got the spearmint iced as recommended but I would have preferred it sweeter or with some other floral/ tea notes. Instead it tasted like I was drinking gum.
author: Nancy Y.

description: I stopped in with a friend for vegan chai and it was delicious. It's a tiny spot with communal benches for sitting and holding tea. They have funky infuser shakers that I don't know yet what they make but they're fun to watch. I would definitely come back again. A little pricey, but hey it's SF and it's an innovative spot so it's worth it.
author: L F.

description: Cute spot in a hipster neighborhood. The drink was tasty but I was disappointed there wasn't really room to sit. It's a good place to pop in for a drink on the go though.
author: Susan V.

description: Beautiful contemporary design with some kind of Mediterranean influence. Not a tea aficionado but the green tea I had was one of the best I've ever had. Love the theater and drinkware. This is a good spot to have a tea and pastry but the smallish community area (made out of stone) is definitely designed to get you going after 20-30m so don't bring your laptop.
author: Will D.

description: Having a Samovar on Valencia feels like a dream come true to me. I absolutely adore Samovar, but sometimes going into a sit-down restaurant just for tea seems like a bit much. This type of cafe set-up is exactly what I'm looking for. I'll be back.
author: Jonathan Z.

description: we were impressed with the taste of mocha latte and good service. yet yes pricey - $5 for a cup of tea after tax!
author: Shuting Z.

description: The chai was absolutely amazing! And the ambiance is perfection. I love tiny spaces and with the simplicity of the space it is perfect for a quiet moment or to enjoy company. The prices are a little steep, prob won't be able to do this as often as I'd like but I will be back for sure.
author: Katie W.

description: Went in on 3/1 at about 2:00. Asked the cashier the difference between chai and Hong Kong chai, Received a super snobby explanation that was INCORRECT, so I ordered the wrong thing. If your intent was to make me look stupid, you succeeded. Thanks for nothing.
author: Kathy R.

description: Blond woman with tattoos was really great. She made some friendly jokes and explained all the different Flavors. She was a real pleasure!
author: scott o.

description: Best Green Tea in the city. All the other tea is great as well. Matcha shake is great on a hot day. Very friendly staff.
author: Mathew K.

description: Overpriced tea, the ambience was pretty good. This place may be a 3.5 stars.
author: George L.

description: walked into this place awhile back and really didn't understand what was happening or why you would have a tea place so cold and uncomfortably designed. nowhere to actually sit and drink tea...true intent of having tea.  i asked for recommendations and she really didn't know much about the options, so tried something that tasted very absynthy or earthy.   i get that the mission is changing, but this may be the crossroad establishment...if this place succeeds, then the mission has morphed into something else and i better start foraging for leaves and learn botany.
author: Roy N.

description: tasted the teas they had on sample and I loved all of them. ended up buying the loose leaf Iron Goddess of Mercy Oolong and when I made a cup at home it was just as amazing as in store. also got a cup of the Four Seasons Oolong to go and that was delicious as well. my drink and samples were all perfectly brewed. I did not try any of the chais or any of their food but it looked and smelled good. Didn't catch the name of the man who helped me but he was very nice and knowledgeable!! will definitely be coming back to try some more teas and food.
author: Mary C.

description: It was good. I had the matcha shake. Wasn't too sweet. The banana donut thingie, I'm seriously a fan of. I'm easy to please.
author: E H.

description:
reaally refreshing green tea and everyone working there is so nice!!
amazing chai, everything is good.
author: A M.

description: Very friendly staff. Good tea. The only problem with the Valencia location is that its not convenient for sitting or relaxing. No tables or chairs just benches (I would have rated it as a 5 otherwise).
author: A N.
